intro: Matelea haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Haiti and the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
